xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #phenotips on 15 April 2014
xwikidoc.content: <groundnuty> has joined #phenotips 02:07 <groundnuty> has quit 04:16 <groundnuty> has joined #phenotips 04:21 <groundnuty> has quit 06:31 <groundnuty> has joined #phenotips 09:26 <vijay13> has quit 09:58 <vijay13> has quit 12:49 <Shubham1> has quit 15:20 <akats> has joined #phenotips 15:21 <akats> For an XWikiUsers object to work does it need to have name, password filled? 15:21 <akats> And if password is not filled, then can somebody log in under the account? 15:22 <sdumitriu> No for both 15:22 <sdumitriu> But what are you trying to do? 15:24 <akats> Have a default user that the REST server would use, rather then the Admin account as it does right now 15:24 <akats> I don't think that it impacts security at all, but it still feels wrong 15:24 <sdumitriu> You can mark it as inactive 15:25 <akats> The user? 15:26 <akats> Wouldn't that prevent them from seeing patient docs? 15:26 <sdumitriu> It might, right 15:26 <akats> And also, on a farm, would that user document get replicated on all instances? 18:25 <mcupak> has quit 20:59 <vijay13> has quit
